docs.snippet: Shares of the social networking company are now down 24 percent from their initial public offering earlier this month....
docs.lead_paragraph: Shares of the social networking company are now down 24 percent from their initial public offering earlier this month.
docs.abstract: Shares of Facebook continue to fall sharply, even as stocks on Wall Street move solidly higher; the stock is now 24 percent below its initial offering price of $38, a sign that the bottom is yet to come as options trading begins.

headline.main: Overall Market Turns Up While Facebook Slides

docs.snippet: Eduardo Saverin, who left the company after two years, is assessing how best to manage the extraordinary wealth that will come his way in Facebook’s initial public offering....
docs.lead_paragraph: Eduardo Saverin, who left the company after two years, is assessing how best to manage the extraordinary wealth that will come his way in Facebook’s initial public offering.
docs.abstract: Facebook co-founder Eduardo Saverin, who left the company after two years and is now a Singapore resident, is assessing how best to manage the $3 billion-plus he will gain in Facebook's initial public offering; he says his departure from the United States and giving up American citizenship is not tax-related, even though his tax savings could exceed $100 million.

headline.seo: A Facebook Co-Founder Reflects on the Path Forward
headline.main: A Facebook Co-Founder Reflects on the Path Forward

headline.main: Facebook Is Killing Text Messaging, Report Says

docs.abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column observes the advent of social networking sites like Facebook has enabled many people to create online memorials for departed loved ones.

docs.abstract: David Choe, a graffiti artist who chose Facebook stock instead of cash when he spray-painted the Facebook offices in 2005, says he could be worth more than $500 million. Mr. Choe took to the airwaves on Tuesday to discuss his windfall on The Howard Stern Show.
